citations.narrative:
The facility's contingency plan did not adequately address how emergencies would be handled at this site. An inadequate
contingency plan could affect animal health and well-being. Dealers must develop, document, and follow an appropriate
plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and care of their animals in the event of an
emergency or disaster. The contingency plan must address all the components of 2.134.
The licensee must develop, document, and follow a contingency plan that adequately addresses emergencies that may
arise at this site.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “B” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with a facility
representative.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by 16-JUNE-2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
